pull.title: build: fix mingw miniupnpc cflags
pull.body:
Pulls in a patch I've upstreamed to miniupnpc so that we properly pass our cflags when building it for mingw. See https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/pull/619. Also set `D_WIN32_WINNT` to `0x0601` to match libevent, configure etc. Previously it was being set to `0X501`.

events.body: Instead of introducing a patch into our repository, why not bumping `miniupnpc` sources as we have done for `libnatpmp` in #21209?

> why not bumping miniupnpc sources

I haven't tested them, and don't currently plan to. The 2.2.3 tag is also broken out of the box.

> why not bumping miniupnpc sources

There's also no release/tag that would include my patch. So are you suggesting we move to using the master branch of miniupnpc? I doubt that is good idea, or would be sources that are particularly well tested. The only reason we do that for libnatpmp is because the author hasn't made a release in 7 years.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

verification.payload:
tree a5af7e96eaf4cd106d48fa370aa74667d318a21b
parent 8e2d93ff0fee36baf7fe88662c83f5b4f40f0add
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1661945759 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1663853765 +0100

build: set D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0601 for mingw miniupnpc

This matches configure, and what we set for libevent etc.

events.message:
build: set D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0601 for mingw miniupnpc

This matches configure, and what we set for libevent etc.

events.body:
re-ACK 859644b

Only a comment has been added since my last review. Agree with pulling in this patch than the alternative of using the upstream master branch as source. Guix hashes match.

ACK 859644b3c8550bb596fc8823747859e772dd493a, I've verified introduced changes in compiler flags, including the case with `DEBUG=1`.

It seems worth mentioning that 8e2d93ff0fee36baf7fe88662c83f5b4f40f0add also makes passing the correct optimization flags--`-O2` for release build and `-O1` for debug build--instead of `-Os`.

comments.body:
Does this actually work?

`Makefile.mingw` defines `_WIN32_WINNT` in CPPFLAGS, which it puts on the commandline after CFLAGS, so I would expect it to override whatever we put in CFLAGS here...

> Does this actually work?

Yes.

`make -C depends/ HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32 -j9 miniupnpc V=1`.

master (a9049dd296a47319038d8c34bcc1ca46c89dee9c):
```bash
x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc -Wall -W -Wstrict-prototypes -Os -DNDEBUG -D_WIN32_WINNT=0X501 -DMINIUPNP_STATICLIB -c -o upnpcommands.o upnpcommands.c
```

This PR (1a332c78dbc78a8fd941289c21e662b10bd3b914):
```bash
x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc -pipe -std=c11 -O2 -D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0601 -DMINIUPNP_STATICLIB -c -o upnpcommands.o upnpcommands.c
```
Ah, apparently this part has changed in master miniupnpc. Maybe add a comment or assert-like check to ensure we don't bump it without fixing?
I've added a comment for the next update.
